Modular math functions

A common reason to use a large-integer library is to implement public-key encryption, and the algorithms for such encryption often use modular math.

integer boost::xint::blockable::invmod (const integer &n, const integer &m)

Detailed Description

Greatest Common Denominator and Least Common Multple for blockable integers.

Also holds the definition for invmod, since it uses the GCD algorithm.
